column4: Where can I find some plugins to be added to gnome, such as CPU graphic ?
Right click the panel and choose "Add to panel...'
There's a system monitor applet, try that.
if that fails, try gdesktlets, which contain far more status monitor shit than you'l;ll ever need or want.

I had a very bad RAM management in Breezy. My SWAP was getting full, so I've downgraded to Hoary and here I have no problem. So this kernel changes might solve my problem ? Should I try to upgrade to Breezy again ?
How much ram/swap do you have?
I have 256mb DDR.
Do you use gnome?
yes, I do.
Gnome, when just running, would be using pretty much all of your ram. Any apps you start will make the machine start to swap. Do you use Evolution?
no, I don't use Evolution. And using Hoary I hardly ever have SWAP in use and with sarge I've NEVER ever had SWAP beeing used, only after some days of uptime.
in all systems (breezy, hoary, sarge) I use the same applications. So for me there is clearly a bad performace on Breezy comparing to Hoary and mainly to sarge.
*nod* Do you have xorg transparency enabled?
... or using beagle?
no, none of these features.
How about when using a different kernel under breezy?
I don't have enough experience in linux to do it by myself.
do you suggest any tutorial ?
Try the hoary kernel under breezy, just install & boot.
is there any documentation that I would learn how to do such changes with kernel ?
Just the package, no changing of anything else.
so it is easier than I thought ;D
There is a java 1.4 applet, which doesn't work on most sites.
